definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: The temple is built in the likeness of the universe and i alsos its reduced image.
sentences.chinese: 寺庙被构建的和宇宙相当近似甚至就是宇宙的翻版。

sentences.english: The most luxurious outdoor home theaters are nostalgic reminders of the drive-in theaters of old.
sentences.chinese: 最奢华的户外电影院是老式汽车影院的怀旧翻版。

sentences.english: Frances is the spitting image of her beautiful mother.
sentences.chinese: 法兰西斯真是她漂亮妈咪的翻版哪。

sentences.english: Gordon's painting was an almost perfect facsimile of the original.
sentences.chinese: 戈登的绘画简直像是原作的翻版。

sentences.english: He s the spitting image of his father.
sentences.chinese: 他简直就是他父亲的翻版。

sentences.english: I have described this election as a modern day version of King Kong versus Godzilla.
sentences.chinese: 我把这次选举描绘成一场巨猿与恐龙搏斗的现代翻版。

sentences.english: Are you aware that everything in our life always seemingly imitates each other?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有发觉，人间万事好像总是彼此的翻版。

sentences.english: The analog to Shred is Backstab, which is positional.
sentences.chinese: 猫的撕碎是盗贼背刺的翻版，是要求位置的。

sentences.english: This new version is the past, and no different past can ever have existed .
sentences.chinese: 这是过去的翻版，与过去的毫无区别。

sentences.english: I am probably one of the most bootlegged artists out there.
sentences.chinese: 我可能是受翻版之害最甚的艺人之一。

sentences.english: B: It's just a facelift of the KS car.
These commercials are just warmed-over imitations of earlier tv ads.
sentences.chinese: 这些商业广告只是早些时候电视广告的翻版。

sentences.english: In short, Chen Yufan is the new Annie Yi.
sentences.chinese: 简而言之，陈羽凡就是翻版的伊能静。

sentences.english: His olive-green shirt, however, looks like the uniform of soldiers in the US Army.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他橄榄绿的衬衫，看起来却像美军军衫的翻版。

sentences.english: Any reprint , similar to simulation, duplicating may touch legal liability .
sentences.chinese: 任何翻版，近似模拟，复制均有可能触及法律责任。

definition: to be precisely the same/to be no different
similar in expression and spirit/to bear a remarkable resemblance to
to resemble one another/to be alike/similar
lit. from head to tail (idiom); thoroughgoing/through and through/out and out/from top to bottom
a faulty stroke in calligraphy or painting/a faulty expression in writing
to copy/to produce sth after a model/to counterfeit
as different as can be (idiom)/poles apart
